verses.text: 治好百夫長的僕人耶穌向群眾講完這一切話，就進了迦百農。
有百夫長所重用的一個奴僕，病得快要死了。

words.note: Indicates a passive or nominalized verb phrase.

verses.text: 百夫長聽見耶穌的事，就打發猶太人中幾個長老到他那裡，求他去醫治他的奴僕。
長老們就來見耶穌，懇切地求他說：「你給他行這事，是他配得的，
因為他愛我們的人民，給我們建造會堂。」
耶穌就和他們同去。離那家不遠的時候，百夫長派幾個朋友來說：「主啊，不必勞駕，因為你到舍下來，我實在不敢當，

words.note: Lit. 'hundred-men chief'
Vocative particle '啊' used after '主'.
Polite expression to ask someone to do something or apologize for troubling.
A humble way to refer to one's home.
Polite expression of humility.

verses.text: 我也覺得沒有資格去見你；只要你說一句話，我的僕人就必好了。
因為我自己是在別人的權下，也有兵在我以下；我對這個說：『去！』他就去；對另一個說：『來！』他就來；對我的僕人說：『作這個！』他就作。」
耶穌聽見這些話，就很驚奇，轉身對跟隨的眾人說：「我告訴你們，這樣的信心，我在以色列中從來沒有見過。」

words.note: Lit. 'trust-heart', denoting inner conviction.

verses.text: 奉派的人回到家裡，見那奴僕已經好了。

words.note: Implies being sent by a superior.

verses.text: 使拿因城寡婦的兒子復活後來耶穌往拿因城去，與他同去的有門徒和一大群人。

words.note: Lit. 'gate follower'

verses.text: 他走近城門的時候，有人把一個死人抬出來，是個獨生子，他母親又是個寡婦。城裡有一大群人陪著她。

words.note: Connects a preceding phrase to modify the following noun.
Introduces object of verb, often implying disposal or impact.

verses.text: 主看見了，就憐憫她，對她說：「不要哭！」

words.note: Used as a title for Jesus.
Indicates completion of an action.
Indicates consequence or immediacy.
Used with '不' to form a negative imperative.

verses.text: 於是上前按著槓子，抬的人就站住。他說：「青年人，我吩咐你起來！」

words.note: Indicates a consequence or logical progression.
Forms a relative clause or nominalizes a verb/phrase.
Indicates consequence or immediacy.

verses.text: 那死人就坐起來，開口說話，耶穌就把他交給他母親。

words.note: Indicates consequence or immediacy.
Indicates consequence or immediacy.
Introduces object of verb, often implying disposal or impact.

verses.text: 眾人都驚懼，頌讚 神說：「有偉大的先知在我們中間興起來了！」又說：「 神眷顧他的子民了！」

words.note: More formal/literary than 害怕 (hàipà).
The CUV often uses '　神' for reverence.
Lit. 'one who knows first'.
Indicates movement towards speaker or emergence.
Often refers to God's chosen people.

verses.text: 於是這話傳遍了猶太和周圍各地。
約翰派門徒去見耶穌約翰的門徒把這一切事告訴約翰。他就叫了兩個門徒，

words.note: Marks the direct object of a verb when placed before it.

verses.text: 差他們往主那裡去，說：「你就是那位要來的，還是我們要等別人呢？」

words.note: Forms a noun phrase 'the one who...'

verses.text: 兩人來到耶穌跟前，說：「施洗的約翰差我們來問你：『你就是那位要來的，還是我們要等別人呢？』」

words.note: Often used in '施洗的約翰' (John the Baptist).
Forms a noun phrase 'the one who...'

verses.text: 就在那時候，耶穌治好許多患疾病的、遭災難的、身上有污鬼附著的，並且施恩給瞎眼的，使他們看見。

words.note: Biblical term for 'evil spirit'.
Specifically refers to divine grace or favor.

verses.text: 耶穌回答他們：「你們回去，把看見和聽見的都告訴約翰，就是瞎的可以看見，跛的可以走路，患痲風的得到潔淨，聾的可以聽見，死人復活，窮人有福音聽。

words.note: Introduces object of a verb, often indicating disposal/handling.
Refers to the disease of leprosy.
Often used in a spiritual or ceremonial sense in the Bible.
Primarily used in religious contexts for rising from the dead.
Lit. 'blessed news'.

verses.text: 那不被我絆倒的，就有福了。」

words.note: Used to form passive voice.
Figuratively means to cause someone to falter or sin.
Often used in religious context, e.g., 'Blessed are...'.
Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 耶穌論約翰約翰差來的人走了以後，耶穌對群眾講起約翰來，說：「你們到曠野去，是要看甚麼？被風吹動的蘆葦嗎？

words.note: Indicates completion of an action.
Indicates direction or serves as a verb complement.
Common biblical term for desert or barren land.

words.definition: to want, to be going to

words.note: Used to form passive voice.

words.definition: to be blown, moved by wind

words.note: Common plant, often found by water, symbolic of weakness or instability.
Forms a yes-no question.

verses.text: 你們出去到底要看甚麼？身穿華麗衣服的人嗎？這些衣服華麗，生活奢侈的人，是在王宮裡的。

words.note: Used in questions to emphasize or ask 'what on earth'.

words.definition: to want, to be going to

words.note: Forms a yes-no question.

verses.text: 那麼，你們出去要看甚麼？先知嗎？我告訴你們，是的。他比先知重要得多了。
聖經所記：『看哪，我差遣我的使者在你面前，他必在你前頭預備你的道路』，這句話是指著他說的。

words.note: Lit. 'holy scripture'
Indicates the following verb is the object of the preceding noun, or forms a nominalized clause.
An exclamation to draw attention, common in biblical texts.
More formal than 送 (sòng) or 派 (pài).
Lit. 'sent person', often used for angels or divine messengers.
Expresses strong certainty or necessity.
Can refer to a physical road or a metaphorical 'way of life'.

verses.text: 我告訴你們，婦人所生的，沒有一個比約翰更大，然而在 神的國裡最小的比他還大。」

words.note: In biblical context often refers to women in general, particularly in relation to childbirth.
Indicates the following verb is the object of the preceding noun, or forms a nominalized clause.
Refers to John the Baptist.
A formal conjunction, often used in written or formal speech.
A blank space used in Chinese Bibles to show reverence for God.
Refers to the Kingdom of God/Heaven in a biblical context.

verses.text: 眾人和稅吏受過約翰的洗禮，聽見這話，就稱 神為義。

words.note: Tax collectors were often despised in ancient Israel for collaborating with foreign powers.
Refers to John the Baptist.
Lit. 'washing rite'.
A blank space used in Chinese Bibles to show reverence for God.
Can be a noun (righteousness) or adjective (righteous).

verses.text: 但法利賽人和律法師，未受過約翰的洗禮，就拒絕 神對他們的美意。

words.note: A Jewish sect in ancient Israel, often portrayed as legalistic in the Bible.
Refers to scribes or teachers of Jewish law.
More formal than 沒 (méi).
Refers to John the Baptist.
Lit. 'washing rite'.
A blank space used in Chinese Bibles to show reverence for God.
Refers to God's benevolent intention or plan.

verses.text: 耶穌又說：「我要把這世代的人比作甚麼呢？他們好像甚麼呢？

words.definition: will, want to, be going to

words.note: Refers to a period of human existence.

verses.text: 他們好像小孩子坐在巿中心，彼此呼叫，說：『我們給你們吹笛子，你們卻不跳舞；我們唱哀歌，你們也不啼哭。』

words.note: Equivalent to 'agora' in Greek scripture.
笛子 (flute) is 笛 (flute) + 子 (suffix).

verses.text: 因為施洗的約翰來了，不吃飯，不喝酒，你們說他是鬼附的。

words.note: Literally 'demon-attached'.

verses.text: 人子來了，又吃又喝，你們說：『你看，這人貪食好酒，與稅吏和罪人為友。』

words.note: A title Jesus used for himself.
Used in '又...又...' structure.
Used in '又...又...' structure.
Tax collectors were often despised in ancient Jewish society.

verses.text: 但 神的智慧，藉著他的兒女就證實是公義的了。」

words.note: Often preceded by a space in some Bible editions as a mark of reverence.

verses.text: 赦免犯了罪的女人有一個法利賽人，請耶穌同他吃飯，他就到法利賽人家去赴席。

words.note: V-O compound with aspect particle
Transliteration of 'Pharisee' + 'person'
Verb-object compound
Pharisee + house
Verb-object compound

verses.text: 那城裡有一個女人，是個罪人，她知道耶穌在法利賽人家裡吃飯，就拿著一玉瓶香膏，

words.note: Pharisee + house + inside
Verb-object compound
Verb with durative aspect marker
Lit. 'jade bottle', refers to expensive ointment container

verses.text: 站在耶穌背後，挨近他的腳哭，她開始用淚水沾濕他的腳，然後用自己的頭髮擦乾，又不住地吻他的腳，並且抹上香膏。

words.note: Verb with directional/resultative complement

verses.text: 請他的法利賽人看見了，心裡說：「這人若是先知，必定知道摸他的是誰，是怎樣的女人，因為她是個罪人！」

words.note: Transliteration of 'Pharisee' + 'person'
Verb with resultative complement and aspect particle
Lit. 'fore-knower'
Nominalizes '摸他' (the one who touches him)

verses.text: 耶穌對他說：「西門，我有句話要對你說。」他說：「老師，請說。」

words.note: Measure word for sentences/words
Respectful term for teacher

verses.text: 耶穌說：「一個債主有兩個債戶，一個欠五百銀幣，一個欠五十。
他們都無力償還，債主就把兩人豁免了。他們之中哪一個更愛他呢？」

words.note: Often used in contexts of forgiveness or exemption from penalty.

verses.text: 西門回答：「我想是那個多得恩免的。」耶穌說：「你判斷對了。」

words.note: Refers to receiving grace or being forgiven.

verses.text: 於是轉身向著那女人，對西門說：「你看見這女人嗎？我進了你的家，你沒有給我水洗腳，但這女人用眼淚濕了我的腳，用頭髮擦乾。

words.note: A common custom and act of hospitality in biblical times.

verses.text: 你沒有和我親吻；但這女人，自從我進來，就不住地親我的腳。
你沒有用油抹我的頭；但這女人用香膏抹我的腳。

words.note: Refers to perfumed oil or balm used for anointing.

verses.text: 所以我告訴你，她許多罪都蒙赦免了，因為她的愛多；那赦免少的，愛就少。」

words.note: Often implies receiving grace or favor, especially in religious contexts.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, 'the one who...'

verses.text: 耶穌就對她說：「你的罪赦免了。」

words.note: Indicates an immediate or logical consequence.

verses.text: 跟他一起吃飯的人心裡說：「這是誰，竟然赦罪呢？」

words.note: A verb-object compound specifically meaning 'to forgive sins'.

verses.text: 耶穌對那女人說：「你的信救了你，平安地去吧！」

words.note: Often used in blessings and farewells in a spiritual sense.
Connects an adjective or noun to a verb, forming an adverb.
Indicates a suggestion or mild command.
